ygData.subject: RE: utter fustration
ygData.msgSnippet: Guild Sibling - yes.  Fellow Twinkie - yes.  Brother bard - yes.  And someday soon (if he stays away from me and my adventures) peer as well. I noticed that
ygData.messageBody:
Guild Sibling - yes. Fellow Twinkie - yes. Brother bard - yes. And
someday soon (if he stays away from me and my adventures) peer as well.

I noticed that little item on his equipment list. But I am pretty sure that
is a family heirloom -- passed down from his [adopted] mother who has
recently decided to drink the potion of the 100 years of sleep as she is
(and has been for quite sometime) utterly uninterested pursing her Bardic
career in the higher levels. Sadly - she will be very missed <crys>

Sylly

p.s. I'll drag your corpse to behind the tree in the Court Yard while you
tell me again about how none of the Lizzies in here can see invs...

-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Honeyman [mailto:honeyman@...]
Sent: Tuesday, December 07, 1999 1:41 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] utter fustration

From: Ryan Honeyman <honeyman@...>

> Can I have your Yaks? Even just one would be great! <g>
I'll only borrow
> em til you come back!

heh. I do recall one of your peers in SotM seems to have
one. I believe it doesn't even proc for him yet, I'm sure
he
wouldn't mind giving it up (purely for your practice of
course) ;p

Harm.
